edge: Mujhse Shaadi Karogi is a romantic comedy film directed by David Dhawan.
David Dhawan is the director of Mujhse Shaadi Karogi.
Sajid Nadiadwala produced Mujhse Shaadi Karogi.
Salman Khan is an actor in Mujhse Shaadi Karogi, playing one of the two men who try to win a woman's heart.
Akshay Kumar is an actor in Mujhse Shaadi Karogi, playing one of the two men who try to win a woman's heart.
Priyanka Chopra is an actor in Mujhse Shaadi Karogi, playing the woman whose heart the two men are trying to win.
Amrish Puri is an actor in Mujhse Shaadi Karogi, appearing in a supporting role.
Kader Khan is an actor in Mujhse Shaadi Karogi, appearing in a supporting role.
Satish Shah is an actor in Mujhse Shaadi Karogi, appearing in a supporting role.
Rajpal Yadav is an actor in Mujhse Shaadi Karogi, appearing in a supporting role.
Mujhse Shaadi Karogi is primarily set in Goa.
Wanting to re-invent himself, David Dhawan decided to make Mujhse Shaadi Karogi as a deviation from his signature mass-market comedies in look and feel.
Sameer's girlfriend Roma breaks up with him due to his temper issues.
Sameer's anger-management issues cause strained relationships, as seen in the breakup with Roma.
According to his horoscope, Sameer is unlucky in love, leading him to become a lifeguard in Goa to avoid further relationship issues.
Arun is Sameer's best friend and the only person who can calm down his temperament, as mentioned in the context.
After becoming a lifeguard in Goa, Sameer tries to escape further relationship issues due to his horoscope.

Suraj accuses Sameer of being a thief and asks him about the location of important items, causing Sameer to stay awake all night on the train. Suraj admits to conning Sameer into guarding his luggage and putting him on night guard duty for three months at the resort.
Sameer falls in love with Rani after meeting her, but their relationship is strained when Sameer disagrees with Rani's father and she overhears him saying negative things about her to an astrologer.
Suraj puts Rani's fiancé, Sameer, on night guard duty for three months at the resort, causing a crimp in their wedding plans.
Rani becomes angry with Jugraj Singh when she overhears him saying negative things about her to an astrologer, straining their relationship.
Sameer disagrees with Pandit Raj Purohit Jyotshi's advice and opinions, causing a rift in their relationship.
Suraj is a security guard at Sameer's resort, putting him in a position of authority over Sameer during the train incident.

Sameer makes another attempt to apologise to Rani and her parents at a cricket stadium where India and Pakistan are playing a friendly match. Sameer asks Rani to marry him in front of the crowd, and Rani runs onto the field and embraces him, thus reuniting with him.
Suraj is Rani's uncle who now knows that Sameer loves her.
Pushpa mistakes Rani's mother for Rani and tries to persuade her to marry Sameer.
Sunny gets close to Rani through Sameer's mistakes.
Sunny taunts Sameer and tells him that he got close to Rani through Sameer's mistakes.

Sameer breaks through security, takes the microphone from the guest of honour Kapil Dev, and apologises to Rani and her parents at a cricket stadium where India and Pakistan are playing a friendly match.
Arun decides to help Sameer by posing as his enemy, telling Rani and her parents earlier.
When Arun came to Goa to cure Sameer's anger-management issues, he met Pushpa, who told him about Sameer's heartbreak and departure for Goa.
Rani's mother tells her daughter to carefully consider whom she loves more: Sameer or Sunny.
Sameer takes the microphone from the guest of honour Kapil Dev at a cricket stadium where India and Pakistan are playing a friendly match.
set of Goa created by art director Sharmishta Roy for the movie was detailed and became a talk of the industry for its fine detailing.
principal photography for outdoor scenes, songs, and other scenes were filmed in Mauritius for a month-long schedule with 300 people making up the unit.
the climax of the movie featuring several cricketers from the Indian team was filmed at a Bangalore stadium in June 2004.
the soundtrack album contains seven original songs composed by Sajid-Wajid and one remix composed by Anu Malik.
lyrics for five songs were written by Jalees Sherwani, one song each by Sameer and Arun Bhairav.
vocals for eight songs in the soundtrack album were performed by Udit Narayan, Alka Yagnik, Sonu Nigam, Sunidhi Chauhan, Sukhwinder Singh, and Shabab Sabri.
Mujhse Shaadi Karogi was a major commercial success, earning ₹ 565 million at the box office and thus becoming the fourth-highest-grossing Bollywood film of the year.
The film also opened well in the overseas market, ranking eighth at the UK box office over its first weekend.
Mujhse Shaadi Karogi opened well throughout India, despite poor weather,

node_2: fourth-highest-grossing bollywood film of the year
edge: Mujhse Shaadi Karogi was a major commercial success, earning ₹ 565 million at the box office and thus becoming the fourth-highest-grossing Bollywood film of the year.
The DVD of Mujhse Shaadi Karogi was released on 27 September 2004 in all regions on a single NTSC-format disc.
Mujhse Shaadi Karogi earned ₹ 565 million at the box office.
The DVD of Mujhse Shaadi Karogi was distributed by T-Series and included deleted scenes, extra songs, a theatrical trailer and TV advertisements.
Mujhse Shaadi Karogi was well received by critics, who praised the film's direction, cinematography, choreography, costumes, styling and performances.
The film also opened well in the overseas market, ranking eighth at the UK box office over its first weekend.
Mujhse Shaadi Karogi opened well throughout India, despite poor weather,
The review from The Hindu describes Mujhse Shaadi Karogi as 'pure entertainment'.
Subhash K. Jha called David Dhawan's Mujhse Shaadi Karogi 'smartest comedy to date' in his review for Indo-Asian News Service.
Taran Adarsh gave Mujhse Shaadi Karogi four stars out of five in his review for Bollywood Hungama.
In the review from The Hindu, Salman Khan's performance in Mujhse Shaadi Karogi was described as showing 'more brawn than histrionics'.
In the review from The Hindu, Akshay Kumar's performance in Mujhse Shaadi Karogi was praised as displaying a 'real flair for comedy'.
Taran Adarsh described the locations in Mujhse Shaadi Karogi as 'stylishly shot at some panoramic locales of Mauritius'.
Sukanya Verma praised Akshay Kumar's performance in Mujhse Shaadi Karogi as displaying a 'real flair for comedy' in her review for Rediff.com.
In their review, The Hindu praised Mujhse Shaadi Karogi for its 'clean humour'.
Planet Bollywood gave 7.5 out of 10, calling it a 'pure entertainment that is high on production value' and a 'good escapist cinema' for both masses and classes.
